Class SaveData

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.data.SaveData
public class SaveData extends Object
The SaveData class manages reading and writing the game settings and player saved data to a text file.

The save file is stored as a simple line-based text file. Each line corresponds to a specific setting defined in SaveDataType.

This class is responsible for:

  • Create the save file with default settings
  • Overwrite individual settings by line
  • Read integers, strings, booleans, key codes, and formatted lists
  • Map SaveDataType values to their corresponding line number

All fields and methods are static because save data is shared globally.

  • Method Details

    • createSaveFile

      public static void createSaveFile()
      Creates a save file if it does not already exist.

      The save file is created with default game settings and controls.

    • overWriteFile

      public static void overWriteFile(String newData, int line) throws IOException
      Overwrites a specific line in the save file with a new string value.
      Parameters:
      newData - the new string to write
      line - the line number to overwrite
      Throws:
      IOException - if file access fails

    • overWriteFile

      line - the line number to overwrite
      Throws:

    • overWriteFile

      public static void overWriteFile(double newData, int index, int line) throws IOException
      Overwrites a value inside a list separated by colons on a specific line.
      Parameters:
      newData - the new double value to replace
      index - the position in the list to modify
      line - the file line to modify
      Throws:
      IOException - if file access fails

      Parameters:
      eventType - the type of save data
      Returns:
      the line number

    • ReadFileList

      public static String[] ReadFileList(int line) throws IOException
      Reads a list separated by colons from the specified line. If no colon is present, returns a single-element array.
      Parameters:
      line - the line to read
      Returns:
      an array of values from the line
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading fails
